com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class Findable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Findable

  • public abstract class Findable
extends Object
    May be supplied by a document viewer (via getFindable()) to support textual searching inside the viewer.

    The following example shows how to create a Findable as an anonymous inner class. Note that this code comes from the example in DocumentViewerFactory and assumes that there is a global String variable called residues.

    
 new Findable(){
    public boolean find(FindOptions options){
        //normaly there would be code in here to select the region that matches the search
        //but since this viewer does not select, it sufficient to simply state whether a
        //match was found or not.
        return residues.contains(options.getText().toUpperCase());
    }
};

      User options for a search.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public abstract boolean find(Findable.FindOptions options)
        Performs a find using the given options. This method is always invoked from the swing thread. Potentially slow running Findables should implement find(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Findable.FindOptions, jebl.util.ProgressListener) instead.
        Parameters:
        options - to use
        Returns:
        true if something was found

      • find

        public boolean find(Findable.FindOptions options,
           ProgressListener progressListener)
        A Findable implementation may optionally implement this variation of find(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Findable.FindOptions) if it may take a noticable amount of time to perform the search. Unlike find(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Findable.FindOptions) which is always invoked in the swing thread, this method is always invoked outside of the swing thread.

        The default implementation of this method calls find(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Findable.FindOptions) from the swing thread and does not return until find(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Findable.FindOptions) returns.

        Parameters:
        options - the options to use when searching
        progressListener - for optionally reporting progress and checking if the user wishes to cancel the search
        Returns:
        true if something was found.

      • getAdditionalOptions

        public Options getAdditionalOptions(Callable<String> currentSearchTextGetter)
        A sub-class can optionally override this to replace the standard isCaseSensitive with some custom options. The values of theese options can be accessed using Findable.FindOptions.getAdditionalOptions()

        As of 2007-09-20, only the nonadvanced options will be displayed. This may be changed in the future.

        Parameters:
        currentSearchTextGetter - A callback method through which a client can retrieve the current value of the search text option, i.e. the value that (@link FindOptions#getText} would have if a search was started now.
        Returns:
        some Options to replace the default options (only a case sensitive option) or null to use the default options (only a case sensitive option)

      • canFindAll

        public boolean canFindAll()
        Returns true if this Findable supports doing a "Find All" search. If so then Findable.FindOptions.isFindAll() will return true if the user clicked the "Find All" button.

        The default implementation returns false

        Returns:
        true if this Findable supports doing a "Find All" search. If so then Findable.FindOptions.isFindAll() will return true if the user clicked the "Find All" button
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)
